title: Establishes the offense of unlawfully residing or entering upon school grounds
summary: Establishes the class A misdemeanor of unlawfully residing or entering upon school grounds for the entry upon school grounds, of any sex offender required to register and verify pursuant to the sex offender registration act; grants an exception for persons attending or employed by the school upon such school grounds, or having a family member attending such school, if the defendant enters the school grounds for the limited purposes authorized by the administrator of the school; establishes the class E felony of unlawfully residing or entering upon school ground for the commission of such offense in the second degree after having had a conviction thereof in the previous 5 years.

       AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to establishing  the  offense
         of unlawfully residing or entering upon school grounds

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The penal law is amended by adding two new sections  130.82
    2  and 130.83 to read as follows:
    3  S 130.82 UNLAWFULLY  RESIDING  OR  ENTERING  UPON  SCHOOL GROUNDS IN THE
    4             SECOND DEGREE.
    5    A PERSON IS GUILTY OF UNLAWFULLY  RESIDING  OR  ENTERING  UPON  SCHOOL
    6  GROUNDS  IN  THE SECOND DEGREE WHEN, HAVING BEEN CONVICTED OF AN OFFENSE
    7  DEFINED IN ARTICLE ONE HUNDRED THIRTY, TWO HUNDRED  THIRTY-FIVE  OR  TWO
    8  HUNDRED  SIXTY-THREE OF THIS CHAPTER OR SECTION 255.25, 255.26 OR 255.27
    9  OF THIS CHAPTER, AND THE VICTIM OF SUCH OFFENSE WAS  UNDER  THE  AGE  OF
   10  EIGHTEEN  AT THE TIME OF SUCH OFFENSE OR SUCH PERSON HAS BEEN DESIGNATED
   11  A LEVEL THREE SEX OFFENDER PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION SIX  OF  SECTION  ONE
   12  HUNDRED SIXTY-EIGHT-L OF THE CORRECTION LAW, HE OR SHE KNOWINGLY RESIDES
   13  WITHIN,  OR ENTERS INTO OR UPON ANY SCHOOL GROUNDS, AS DEFINED IN SUBDI-
   14  VISION FOURTEEN OF SECTION 220.00 OF THIS CHAPTER, DURING THE PERIOD  OF
   15  TIME  HE  OR  SHE IS REQUIRED TO REGISTER AND VERIFY PURSUANT TO SECTION
   16  ONE HUNDRED SIXTY-EIGHT-H OF THE CORRECTION LAW.
   17    IT SHALL BE AN AFFIRMATIVE DEFENSE TO THE CRIME OF UNLAWFULLY RESIDING
   18  OR ENTERING UPON SCHOOL GROUNDS IN THE SECOND DEGREE THAT THE  DEFENDANT
   19  (1)  IS A REGISTERED STUDENT OR AN EMPLOYEE OF A SCHOOL UPON SUCH SCHOOL
   20  GROUNDS, OR HAS A FAMILY MEMBER ENROLLED IN A SCHOOL  UPON  SUCH  SCHOOL
   21  GROUNDS,  AND  (2)  ENTERED  UPON  SUCH  SCHOOL  GROUNDS FOR THE LIMITED
   22  PURPOSES AUTHORIZED BY THE SUPERINTENDENT OR CHIEF ADMINISTRATOR OF SUCH
   23  SCHOOL.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

    4             FIRST DEGREE.

    6  GROUNDS IN THE FIRST DEGREE WHEN HE OR SHE COMMITS THE OFFENSE OF UNLAW-
    7  FULLY  RESIDING OR ENTERING UPON SCHOOL GROUNDS IN THE SECOND DEGREE, AS

    9  UNLAWFULLY  RESIDING  OR  ENTERING  UPON  SCHOOL GROUNDS IN THE FIRST OR
   10  SECOND DEGREE IN THE PREVIOUS FIVE YEARS.
   11    UNLAWFULLY RESIDING OR ENTERING  UPON  SCHOOL  GROUNDS  IN  THE  FIRST
   12  DEGREE IS A CLASS E FELONY.
   13    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   14  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
